      • PELE Error Messages
        • General errors in the control file
          • Error in the validation
          • Missing configuration file
          • Missing PeleTasks section, or missing comma before the PeleTasks keyword in the control file
          • Missing comma (,) or curly brace (}) in the control file
          • Missing and opening square bracket ([) in the commands section
          • Property found in the wrong place, or mistyped property name
          • Missing value after keyword
          • Missing command type value
        • Template and parameter related errors
          • Missing atom in the PDB file, or missing TER record
          • Mismatching atoms between template and residue, or extra atoms, or missing TER
          • Missing template
          • Missing OBC parameters
        • Selection errors
          • Wrong range specification
        • Miscellanea
          • Couldn’t create the given file

Compilation¶

You can find a README file explaining how to compile PELE on NBD cluster under /work/NBD_Utilities/PELE/PELE_Compilation/intel

Tutorial¶

You can find PELE tutorial under the folder /work/NBD_Utilities/PELE/PELE_Tutorials/ where you will find:

  • PELE_Method.docx: Document on how the method works

  • EXAMPLE_RUNS_PELE.docx : Document with an overview of the tutorial.

  • PELE++_CONTROL_FILE.docx: Document on how to set PELE parameters.

  • PELE++_EXAMPLES.tar.gz: All example simulations to run.

  • PELE_PCA: Tutorial on how to produce a PCA from several X-rays and plug that one into PELE

  • PELE_PLATFORM: Tutorial on how to launch pele from NBDServer using PELE’s Platform

Templates for launching¶

You can find a PELE input (.conf) and a launching file (.sl) for the NBD cluster under:

  • /work/NBD_Utilities/PELE/PELE_Templates/pele_intel/ (cluster)

Templates for analysis¶

You can find an analysis file with everything explain inside under:

  • /work/NBD_Utilities/PELE/PELE_Templates/analisis.sl (cluster)

Create licenses¶

You can find information about how to create licenses under:

  • /data/users/dsoler/licenses/README.txt (server)
